level.text: The Mayor may contract with an administrator to administer the Energy Efficiency Loan program created by this subchapter.
Chapter 3A of Title 2 shall not apply to the contract authorized by subsection (a) of this section until 3 years after May 27, 2010.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 19-171, in subsec. (b), substituted "Chapter 3A of Title 2" for "Unit A of Chapter 3 of this title".

level.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
level.text: Section 206 of D.C. Law 18-156 added a section to read as follows:
"(a) The Mayor may contract with an administrator to administer the energy efficiency loan program created by this title.

"(b) The District of Columbia Procurement Practices Act of 1985, effective February 21, 1986 (D.C. Law 6-85; D.C. Official Code § 2-301.01 et seq.), shall not apply to the contract authorized by subsection (a) of this section until 3 years after the effective date of this act.
Section 402(b) of D.C. Law 18-156 provides that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.

level.heading: Emergency Act Amendments
level.text: For temporary (90 day) addition, see § 206 of Energy Efficiency Emergency Act of 2009 (D.C. Act 18-324, March 1, 2010, 57 DCR 1851).

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For history of Law 19-171, see notes under § 8-105.02.
